page.lettertext:
fol.223r
4 Octo
b
To my L Trea
s
Belgia 1591 Octo
b
May it please yo
r
good L. upon deliberation had between
e
assembly of
States
&
e
Councel of State
, it is resolved that for
the better direction & countenance of all theyr actions at
e Camp
the Councel shall transport th
e
selves theth
r
,
e rather upon
the hope, that if this p
nt
exploit against
Nieumeg
e
shalbee both happely & speedely atchieved, they shall have
time & opportunity, before
e hard of
e winter, to besiege some
oth
r
place. This daie we de
te from
e Hage toward
Tiel,
to reside eith
r
there or at
Arnham,
or in
e camp it
self, as wh
e
we come theth
r
we shall finde most behoofull
for
e good of
e contrey. There is Intelligence come hether
that certaine cornet
of horse of
e Quarters of
Guelders,
to
e
nomb
r
of 7 as wee are informed ranging abroad in
e country of
Collen,
to seek a bouty, have encountered certain ensignes of
e Enemy about
Kerpen
w
ch
is neere to Coll
e
, & have
defeated to
e nomb
r
of 500 foote at
e least, w
ch
were newly
levied for
e
D. of Parma
, & were appointed to make theyr
rendevous at Kerpen. The losse of o
rs
is 36 horse. Ther
are come heth
r
out of Italy 2 yong m
e
who passing
thorow Dauphine homewhard, arrived there at
e same instant
as
e
count Olivares
was defeated by
Mons
r
D'Esdignieres
,
of w
ch
conflict I am
swaded
e report is come unto yo
u
.
Because
e newes is good, & they were p
nt
at
e
s
vice
I have sent yo
r
L. heerw
th
such spetiall point
, as being here
examined by order of
e Councel, they have confessed upon theyr
knoledge. I am c
r
tainly advertised by some that
have spoken w
th
divers of
Groningen,
that
e chiefest magistrat
of
e towne, who are altogether Spanishe, have attempted of
late to erect a sconce, before one of
e gates & weakest places
of
e Towne. Howbeit
e Commons & confraries have
opposed against them, & have
ceeded so far in contention
together, as
e people tooke
t
l
re
w
ch
I writ unto them
a great while since, & reade yt publikly in theyr meeting,
&
swasyons were used, by some affectionate to her
Ma
ty
, that
they should take an oth
r
course, by rejecting
e Spaniard & cleaving
to her Ma
ty
, But as it seemed they were not willing to joyne
w
th
these provinces in any kinde of union, w
th
out her Ma
t
protection. I am but newly & somwhat rawly informed
heerof, by some
t
know yt to be trewe; but not w
th
every
circumstance. As I shall heerafter be furder advertised
fol.223v
To my L. T
re
r Oc
t
4 1591
Belgia. 1591. Sep
t
and as occasyons are offered I will negotiate heerin for her
Ma
t
service. I have sene from time to time most apparantly
that both
Count Willi
a
&
e states of
Frise,
were never well
enclined, to have
t
towne reduced & associate to
e rest
by her Ma
t
autority, for those jalous conceit
, that I have
signified heertofore, Otherwise I make no dout, but yt might
have bin accomplished. And though this p
nt
dissension
should c
o
tinew in
e towne, their diffidence heer ys alwaies
such, as I am sure I shal be combred, to know how to deale
to make
em take
e benefit, of this passing good occasyon.
Howsoever it be I make acchount, so
t
e place may be
recovered by her Ma
ty
or by them, or in any oth
r
sort, it is
much as her Hig
nes
will require for
t
matter.
Octob
r
4 1591.
